Hi Nacho,

as I'm relatively new to Heritrix, I'll try to answer your quest=
ion
from my point of view.

I guess that the simplest way to invoke Heritri=
x from the Web API:
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Herit=
rix+3.0+API+Guide

What I did was using H3 as dependencies in my Maven base=
d project.
Thus I was able to start H3 through Eclipse directly from the He=
ritrix
class. Also you can add your own=C2=A0Classes to customize the behav=
iour of
H3.

Hope that helps,
norman

On Sonntag, 1. Mai 2011 at 15:19, nch=
2012 wrote:



hi!
What do you think is the easiest way to invoke heritrix =
from my java program?

I found some java code for doing this, from around 2=
006, that receives
as input an "order.xml" file(SimpleHeritrixLauncher.java=
). Then, not
using this code, I ran a sample crawl using the WUI and inspec=
ted the
"order.xml" file that it produced. I was surprised to find that the=

root URL of the crawl did not appear in the "order.xml" file that the
exec=
ution produced. So I am not sure that this code
(SimpleHeritrixLauncher.jav=
a) alone can be of any help.

Thank you in advance for your suggestions and=
 opinions.

Nacho
